intro: Acranthera philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine acranthera, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant is perennial and often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth surface, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Acranthera philippinensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
